channel.title: Comments & Suggestions
channel.description: What do you like about Duffers Golf?

item.title: Maximum approval to Duffers Team
item.author: invalid@example.com (Tha_Smiler)
item.dc:creator: Tha_Smiler
item.content:encoded:
Hi there,

Sorry to see Duffers has got sooo little support from the 'community' Pure slackness

Anyway, I think Duffers is pretty cool and 99% faultless

It's inspired me to have a go at modelling,, hehe,, I can now make pretty tidy and accurate golf landscapes Yeah yeah i kinda understand the tutorial and stuff

I look forward to seeing what comes forth from the Coil stable in the long term Keep up the good work (even if its nothing to do with Duffers)...

Maximum approval to Duffers Team

item.title: maps, servers & skins
item.author: invalid@example.com (JACK SH!T)
item.dc:creator: JACK SH!T
item.content:encoded:
Where can I find more maps/courses to play. The game seems fun, but the same 9 holes get boring fast.
Also, I can't seem to find any servers. Any chance the Duffer's team might host a deadicated server that will show up in the browser? I tried hosting a game but after an hour I was tired of waiting for someone to join.
One more thing.... I think it might be kindda' cool if we had the opption of useing the UT skins for our players, along with the nomal skins.

Hopefully someone...

maps, servers & skins

item.title: Some suggestions
item.author: invalid@example.com (ZappyAd)
item.dc:creator: ZappyAd
item.content:encoded:
Enjoyed playing the mod and think its a great idea for ut2k4 - loads of possibilities. I had some thoughts whilst playing - don't know how many of them you've already thought of but for what its worth...

Found the power meter really difficult to use - don't know if its just me but alot of times the shot didn't work - my third click was obviously too far away from 0% to be counted. Even if its really bad couldn't you just make it count with very low accuracy. At 100% power I was only...

Some suggestions

item.title: an option i would like to see
item.author: invalid@example.com (coldlight)
item.dc:creator: coldlight
item.content:encoded:
I know in a 32 player game this would be absurd, but I have mostly been playing with a groups of 3-4 people.......most of us are wondering if you are going to show other people golfing. Most golf games I have played let you spectate as others play their turn, then it cycles through the turns again.

I would really like to see this feature added as an option at least.

other than that, duffers pwnz.

item.title: what I would like to see
item.author: invalid@example.com (master_newbie)
item.dc:creator: master_newbie
item.content:encoded:
in the minigolf gametype, the other players should be able to walk around instead of just watching the player while he shoots
of course blocking volumes should be added to make sure that they dont walk on the track
but it would be better to watch and more exciting

item.title: Thoughts on Duffers beta
item.author: invalid@example.com (W0RF)
item.dc:creator: W0RF
item.content:encoded:
Sorry I didn't comment on the closed beta. But a lot has been cleaned up since the 2003 version so maybe it's better this way.

In general the shot system seems to be well in place. Great job guys!

My suggestions:

Shots don't go nearly as far as advertised. A driver claims to go 273 at max power but I've never shot the ball farther than 240 off the tee. If I didn't know my clubs better (too much Golden Tee) I would use the "suggested" clubs and shoot much worse. My observations:...

Thoughts on Duffers beta

item.title: the ball marker
item.author: invalid@example.com (Koron)
item.dc:creator: Koron
item.content:encoded: Just a quick suggestion for the marker that shows where you're aiming the ball. It ought to resize itself as it gets further away (smaller) and larger as it gets closer to make it abundantly clear what its function is (I thought it was simply pointing in the direction you were shooting for quite awhile). The distance/club could stay with static-sized text.

item.title: The character Models
item.author: invalid@example.com (Yoshiro)
item.dc:creator: Yoshiro
item.content:encoded: Ok, this mod is pretty fun and a great start. In my opinion though, your models need some work. Either to look more realistic or to go for more of an animated style. The models as they are now I dont feel look good enough. In my opinion I'd go animated style, but from what the models are now it looks like your going realistic. So just my suggestion. Best of luck with this mod

item.title: Show UT2004 community command
item.author: invalid@example.com (Alhanalem)
item.dc:creator: Alhanalem
item.content:encoded:
Have this displayed so that one can switch to another mod easily, or add some means to return to normal UT2004. If i feel like a round of golf while playing UT2k4, i can just switch to it on the community menu, but the reverse is not currently possible.

Great job guys! one other little detail, could you set some BGM music for the map?

item.title: A marker for the flag while it's out of sight?
item.author: invalid@example.com (JaFO)
item.dc:creator: JaFO
item.content:encoded:
I feel like I'm just hitting the ball in a random direction until I'm close enough to actually spot the flag.
It'd definitely help beginners on the golfcourse.

An overhead 'radar'-view of the map would help as well.

Of course this should be selected by the clients/players themselves ...

item.title: Training-maps please !
item.author: invalid@example.com (JaFO)
item.dc:creator: JaFO
item.content:encoded:
I want to be able to practice my shooting & putting without playing the entire course ...

It probably could become a gametype of its own

item.title: view is too low
item.author: invalid@example.com (LP)
item.dc:creator: LP
item.content:encoded:
can you implement a way to move the camera higher, cuz its annoying not being able to see the fairway cuz ur on the back of a hill

and possibly make the mid-air view of the ball further away too, so you get a good idea of where you are

item.title: Port the Maps?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Eddie595)
item.dc:creator: Eddie595
item.content:encoded:
Looking at the preview images it looks like the golf courses are very nicely detailed. My thought is to port one or more of the maps into DM, CTF, vCTF (with golf carts ;-) ) etc and have a map designer alter what is needed to make the map playable in one of these game plays, even possibly using a map designer outside the Golf devolopment team so not to slow the mod production down. This would not only help spread the word to the public about Duffers Golf but it would also add variety in the...

Port the Maps?
